bestBHT.bht: God considers the craftiness and wisdom of the world as folly, using it to trap those who are wise in their own eyes. The world's standards and God's standards are not the same, so it is important for the church to discern whose idea dominates. The wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight, and He takes the wise in their own craftiness. Therefore, we must be willing to be fools in the world's eyes to truly possess wisdom in the eyes of God.

bhtAttempts.bht: God sees the craftiness and wisdom of the world as folly, using it as a net to trap those who are wise in their own eyes. The standards of the world and God are not the same, so it is important for the church to discern whose idea rules within its walls. In God's sight, the wisdom of this world is foolishness, and He turns it to their confusion. While the world may view the wise as clever and versatile, their wisdom is ultimately in vain. Therefore, we must be willing to be fools in the eyes of the world in order to be truly wise in the sight of God.
